meanings.definition: To set or mark the limits or boundaries of something.
meanings.sent1: The fence marginates the garden from the rest of the yard.
meanings.sent2: She carefully marginates the edges of the paper with a ruler.
meanings.sent3: The cat marginates its territory by rubbing against the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His kindness marginates his character, making him stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The bright red line marginates the end of the road, guiding drivers safely.

meanings.definition: To provide with a margin or border.
meanings.sent1: The designer marginates the poster with a colorful border.
meanings.sent2: The notebook is marginated with a blue line on each page.
meanings.sent3: The cake marginates the plate with its delicious frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter marginates the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The clouds marginate the sky, creating a beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: To write in the margin of a book or document.
meanings.sent1: Students often marginate their textbooks with notes and highlights.
meanings.sent2: The professor marginates the important points in the lecture slides.
meanings.sent3: The detective marginates the clues in the case file, trying to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her memories marginate the diary, capturing moments in time.
meanings.sent5: The author marginates the manuscript with corrections and suggestions.
